KEY DATAPOINTS.AUTHOR: Patrick Braeutigam
KEY DATAPOINTS.PROBLEM DESCRIPTION: BMW complained first issues 07/2018 (19.07.) @plant Dingolfing (Hr. Habold MUC). There're no specific OBD failure code. The failure appears after first SCR system initiation (F1_Test). Failed at test step: System leak test. Service 31 ID 0x301 Detailed failure description see attachment (EINFÜGEN!).
KEY DATAPOINTS.CURRENT CONDITION: All BMW plants (using SCR systems) are infected, also all variants (using SCR system). After some minutes the test can be repeated without the failure. BMW decided to send the cars out. Just one system affected were the second test was also not ok. this system will be send to RGB.
KEY DATAPOINTS.TARGET CONDITION: Failure root cause has to be understood and failure occurrence has to be eliminated. Target is to bring F1_testfails to zero % at customer plants
KEY DATAPOINTS.ROOT CAUSE ANALYSIS: Components/systems analysis: TFM/System: Drop of pressure partly reproduceable at RBG testbench since 28.09.2018, but pressure values are still in tolerance and therefore the system leaktest is passed. During this test only the returned TFM was used and therefore the rootcause could be located to the TFM module. RDU: First part was NTF; cleanliness analysis t.b.d CW 40 To be clarified Is there any connection between failure re-occurrence and time between first and second Components analysis in consideration of failure description (leakage, damages, Full pump characterization cw40 to locate source of symptom Optimization of BMW test to be proved. Please consider the additional "fault tree file" and presentation ,,DD additional docs".
KEY DATAPOINTS.COUNTERMEASURES: Alignment with customer is to increase the current test pressure of 5.5bar to 6.5bar (Daimler Setup). Software validation performed and passed. Calibration data was sent 20thof November. BMW internal tests ongoing. Software is planned to be implemented with next I-Step 1430 (active: 07/2019, data freeze: 28.11.2018).
KEY DATAPOINTS.EFFECT CONFIRMATION: Software validation performed and passed. For the evaluation six failed (rejected by customer) and 21 new pumps were used. Results are shown in separate file. Software update in place since I-Step 19-3-510. Monitoring since several months showed a significant decrease of failures (less than 1 percent one car) over all BMW closed by customer. Passive monitoring ongoing on customer site.
